meanings.definition: A bundle of grain stalks tied together after reaping.
meanings.sent1: The farmer gathered the sheaves of wheat in the field.
meanings.sent2: The workers loaded the sheaves onto the truck for transport.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the sheaves as a makeshift bed.
meanings.sent4: The golden sheaves swayed gently in the breeze, like a sea of grain.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the sheaves against the setting sun was truly picturesque.

meanings.definition: A group of things tied or held together.
meanings.sent1: She carefully arranged the sheaves of papers on her desk.
meanings.sent2: The artist displayed his sheaves of paintings at the gallery.
meanings.sent3: The children used the sheaves of sticks to build a fort in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The sheaves of colorful balloons filled the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The sheaves of books on the shelf created a sense of order in the room.
